website_summaries.verdict: Another inexpensive pick for buyers seeking a clear lid set for easy food viewing and storage.
pros: Clear containers allow for easy viewing in fridge
Buyers raved over the product's sturdy feel
cons: The set has problems sticking perfectly if there is condensation around the storage container

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Just hosted Easter brunch and these covers worked really well with my leftovers. I like the idea of being able to leave food in a bowl and cover it with these lids instead of having to transfer it into another food container. The lids are super stretchy and sturdy, very good quality, and keeps food fresh.
customer_reviews.author: J.V.

customer_reviews.title: Leak proof if it’s the right fit!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little covers! I wish you could order more of a specific size. For example, I have no use for the giant ones personally, but I love the medium size ones. The happy faces on them is a nice touch. Quality is solid. I think these will last for a very long time. I use these to save leftovers and also to save “water for later.” Check out my video of the leak-proof test. It totally works if you find the right size for the right container. Trickier with rectangular containers, but doable. It takes forever to dry if you don’t lay it out correctly on the drying rack though.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny W. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Hold tight - these do!
customer_reviews.text: These are super stretchy, good quality silicone. And it's true, there's one to fit practically every small-to-medium size container or bowl in the kitchen. HOWEVER, they are so tight (great - no spills!) that you really need to be very careful if you're covering something with liquids. I find it difficult to cover and uncover while keeping the container/bowl perfectly flat. So, for foods - perfect. for liquids - not so much. (That why just the 4 stars, rather than 5)
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Edit: since then another has ripped , however the company was kind enough to send a full replacement. I’m adding stars for customer service. Product was hard to put on. Was not as flexible as advertised. We just began using it and it ripped when placed over a bowl. Extremely dissatisfied. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Honest

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This product is cheaply made and is not durable. The 2nd time I used it the silicone broke and I didn't even stretch it. Not impressed. :(
customer_reviews.author: Love2Read

customer_reviews.title: I love these! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook, and like to prep ahead of time with bowls of the different ingredients. Since receiving the stretch lids, I use them almost every day. I had been covering my prep bowls with cellophane, but always felt guilty to use so much of it that I always threw away. Now I feel good about helping the environment. Also, when using cellophane, bowls with chopped onions or garlic (for example) - you can still smell that in the refrigerator or on the counter. With stretch lids, no more smell! Stretch lids are made for round containers, and don't work well with oblong or square containers -so I still use ClingWrap for some things.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H. Silvi

customer_reviews.title: Decent product. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. I would buy this again. Yes, they do APPEAR flimsy, but they seem to be decently tough. If these start to tear prematurely, I will update this rating. To date, they are lasting well. GREAT for odd sized items like cans.
customer_reviews.author: Magnetic Dave

customer_reviews.title: Silicone Stretch Lids
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! They allow you to seal things without using plastic wrap. Since these are washable and reusable, you don't need to use plastic wrap. This is a great way to seal things but not have to worry about wasting and throwing away plastic all the time. They come in a variety of sizes so they work for most bowls. They are for the most part leak proof. These are almost perfect. I have only one slight complaint. They aren't the greatest to wash. They fit in the dishwasher funny, but if you handwash most things these should wash nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long enough. Stained easily
customer_reviews.text: These didn't last long in our home. Quite disappointed. Sizes weren't very useful. Ended up with stains on them after second or third use. Had 2 melt in the dishwasher when info said dishwasher safe. Only reason I gave it 1 star is bc it did help us reduce our usage of plastic wrap or foil on dishes.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfOne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, flexible, useful.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Nice assortment of sizes, stretches easily over my glass bowls. I have had no problems resealing even with inside condensation. The plastic lids that came with my Pyrex storage system warped and cracked with use and cleaning. These are a far better option. I have been looking for options to reduce usage of plastic wrap. These strech lids are the perfect solution. I will be giving as gifts this Christmas to all my environmentally aware family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat product. I am always using those shower cap things for my leftovers and cut fruit and they don't reuse very well so enter the silicone stretch lids. Very easy to wash and reuse. My only issue is that there are a limited number of sizes and I would have appreciated a few larger sizes with watermelon season upon us. Otherwise, customer service was excellent, which is a huge plus in my book, and the item is as described.
customer_reviews.author: Powerpuff

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Ripped a majority of them trying to stretch them onto a slightly bigger container than that of the silicone lid...this happened 4 times... on all different containers mind you... I think I was successful twice before I gave up using them at all
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: These kids are super slippery and you have to really angle it right for them to stay on. Not the greatest covered I’d rather use Saran Wrap but I’m trying to be eco friendly
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Z.

customer_reviews.title: I love this and I wish I could get more sizes as well as oval shape
customer_reviews.text: I'm tired of using disposable plastic wrap, and my sister has some silicone lids like this. These work great on glass and ceramic. We have several little bowls that we lost the plastic tops for. It's also great for converting regular dinnerware bowls and cups to storage, because these stretch and you have different sizes. You must dry off the lip so that the silicone grips it and stays sealed. But the stretchy silicone rubber does a great job. I just wish I had more large sizes and oval size to fit my mixing bowls and my big Pyrex measuring bowl with handle. Consider making ones to fit these!
customer_reviews.author: S. Wells

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. COMPLETELY USELESS
customer_reviews.text: I bought it all excited. Well came it look like a fabulous product. Tried it on a glass container cut some watermelon 🍉 put it in the refrigerator as soon as the container got cold 🥶 the cover would not work. Only for dry and room temperature. The whole purpose of the product is for the items in the fridge USELESS
customer_reviews.author: Eliana F Coppola

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, thin, useless.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a lid similar to these and I liked it. It would save on plastic wrap and I wanted to use it to open bottles and lids. These are very thin, extremely thin and not even close to be the quality of what my daughter has. I don't think I would even get it over a dish. I can double it up to open bottles and jars, so I will use them for that and the rest I may be able to use in my craft room for something or other.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Silicone Lids
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these lids. If you happen to have bowls that are round and the diameter of these lids you are in luck. Otherwise, they are too big, too small, don't stretch easily, and are basically useless. I get some disposable ones at Walmart for a few dollars that have a flexibility that these can never have. Would return them if I could. Will probably end up throwing them away.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit anything
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to reduce my use of cling wrap. Unfortunately, these are a huge disappointment. With the wide range of sizes included, it's amazing that I couldn't get a single one to fit my bowls/cups. Either they were too big, and thus obviously not sealing, or too small and would pop off of the containers. This purchase was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: They're OK
customer_reviews.text: So far i'm not loving these. First, they don't stretch to fit any bowl, they basically fit a bowl/glass the same size as the circle, they can't really stretch to fit something larger, and if you put on something smaller it does not cling, it just covers the top. Also-- and I guess I didn't measure my bowls ahead of time so this is partially my mistake-- this set only reallly fits things ranging in size from approximately a juice glass to a small-medium size bowl. I was picturing these fitting substantially larger products, based on the description of fitting "different sizes for different needs."
customer_reviews.author: Dukati

customer_reviews.title: So many great uses for these covers!
customer_reviews.text: I hate using stretchy plastic wraps for covering food--so bad for the environment! These stretchy covers are terrific and come in multiple sizes that fit everything from a big bowl of fruit to a cereal bowl to a small glass! And I love the smiley face design! I use them constantly. Easy to wash--just a little soap and water. I dry them with a dish towel to avoid spots. Great for leftovers but have many other uses, too. Definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Goe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stick well over non-rounded opening
customer_reviews.text: Works for round bowls and glassware that has round circular opening. Doesn’t stretch to cover other shapes. Hard to get it to sticks when it’s wet. I am not very happy with it but I guess at least it’s better than using plastic wraps for now
customer_reviews.author: Hubert Chin

customer_reviews.title: There are some things they don’t work for.
customer_reviews.text: They are great IF the container is room temperature and not damp. Cannot put the cover back on a bowl that you have taken out of the refrigerator and removed part of the contents and want to put the lid back on. Will not adhere. So great for items that do not go into the fridge. Will use them a lot just not for refrigerated items.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to plastic wrap
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been slowly trying to get rid of all of the ‘disposable’ plastic in my household. The very last reason i needed plastic wrap was covering bowls and cans for 1-2 day storage in the refrigerator. These silicon covers work like a charm! they’re easy to clean, easy to use, and fairly easy to store. FYI—there’s a lot of reviews that say these don’t stay on. My guess is they are trying put it on too big a container. They stretch but how much depends on the size—the smallest doesn’t even stretch an inch but the biggest stretches a few inches.. I have put them on ceramic bowls, glass bowls, and cans with no problems at all. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy L

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Quality is really low. Item tore on the first use, really didn't expect it to happen that quickly. Also, it's not the easiest thing to put on. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: gad y.

customer_reviews.title: Modern-day covers - great alternative
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these reusable covers to replace Pyrex container lids that had deteriorated. The covers came in a variety of sizes that has worked well with most of the containers I put them on (one small square container was a bit difficult to cover, but it did cover). So far, the seal is excellent and cleaning them with Dawn dish detergent removes any grease/oils and food smells. I have not tried them in the microwave, although I think they are microwave safe. We will consider using more reusable items such as this to replace plastics in our everyday lives.
customer_reviews.author: JaKu

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: These have changed my life in a good way. I only wish they made them even larger for my biggest bowls. They are great for storing stuff in round , square or rounded bowls, and when you stretch the lid on you can stack on top which is also a great space saving feature. One of mine did break after a few months but the rest are holding up well. would make a good gift.
customer_reviews.author: RMNYC

customer_reviews.title: Works fine- as long as the lid fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These silicone stretch lids work pretty well but the sizes are very specific. So there are 3 lids we've never used because they don't really fit anything we have. I would recommend getting a larger pack of lids with more sizes to use. But for the fairly low price, this is a fair product. Liquid doesn't leak out, as long as the lid perfectly fits your bowl/container. I find that the lids are often a little too small or a little too large, making them a bit useless.
customer_reviews.author: P@¡n ₩@rr¡0rTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Measure your lidless containers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to cut down on plastic wrap. These really don't stretch to cover 'in between sizes', but I have various bowls I use constantly and luckily they fit those. In retrospect, it would have been smart to measure the diameters before ordering rather than relying on luck. The smallest size is perfect for 3 oz. cat food cans. That said, a size that would fit the average can of tuna would be delightful. The next size up is slightly too large.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Great covers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the purpose of using one to cover a large flour container (the glass lid broke). It works great for that, but I also find myself using the other sizes for all sorts of bowls that never had covers like ceramic pottery bowls, small bowls for leftovers, etc. I bake a lot of bread and I use them to cover the dough bowl while it rises. They stretch pretty easily and have tabs all around to make the stretching even easier. I highly recommend these if you have bowls that need a cover. I only use them in the fridge or at room temp, I wouldn't microwave with the lids on.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product ... with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: We'd been looking for a product like this and we found it with yours. It's just what we were looking for. Just one thing that your future customers might like. We had your product for less than three days when you began to annoy us with your request for a review. The least your could have done was to give us some time to actually use them before asking us to review them. A month? Maybe a couple of weeks. Perhaps you might take note of this.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Stern

customer_reviews.title: The one thing that really interested me was using it on a watermelon
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that while these lids work great on cans, they absolutely DO NOT work on watermelons. I tried everything including drying off the condensation from taking it out of the refrigerator (maybe it would work on a room temperature one), but even if you can get it to completely cover the cut watermelon it just slips off. I had to feed my dog canned food for 2 weeks. I used the lid for that. It worked perfectly, even cold from the refrigerator (I think it might have been holding on to the paper label.
customer_reviews.author: Construction Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: a great way to reduce plastic use
customer_reviews.text: Great product... The package includes several sizes; they take the place of plastic wrap covering dishes, fruits, or vegetables that are round. They're stretchy and easy to use, and I think work better than plastic wrap for keeping foods. Easy to wash... I'm expecting they will last. And I understand that silicone is a better choice than plastic in terms of both health and environment.
customer_reviews.author: CAC

customer_reviews.title: Silicone Stretch Lids
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea but for me this did not work . They were very hard to put on and I never got one on. My husband did but he said if it had been another dish it would have spilled all over, Great idea but did not work for me. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kathy northcott

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly useful
customer_reviews.text: I think there was a pretty good chance for these to end up in the trash after a couple weeks, but they're actually really useful. The work best if the outside of the bowl is clean and dry, any water or oil makes the grip tricky. I've used all of the sizes quite a bit, especially with holiday leftovers. I have a small kitchen and it's handy to be able to turn any bowl into covered storage, and it's WAY better than cling wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Julia San Diego

customer_reviews.title: These are nice but very clingly
customer_reviews.text: These lids stick together even after washing while in storage. I have different size bowls that some of the lids don't fit on, so I'm not sure what to do. The lids have a ridges on the sides that I thought would mean they fit different size bowls, but they don't. The tabs are flimsy and I am afraid to pull too hard so that the tabs don't tear or break. I will use the ones I have, but still have to have some plastic wrap for other bowls.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product met my expectations. They stretch to fit securely, and they keep food sealed and fresh. I do have some large bowls that they are not large enough for, but the variety of sizes included fit most small to medium sized bowls.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Camp

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: A friend had these on some food containers she brought to a party. I liked them so much I immediately ordered some on Amazon. They work well and clean up easily. My only complaint is that I use some sizes more than others and wish I could order these separately. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KathyHH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Covers any open dish so that it can be placed in the refrigerator - stretches to cover any oddly shaped dishes. Easy to put on - take off - and rinse when it has been used. Much, much easier to use than plastic film, which cannot be easily unwrapped from the roll. I recommend this product highly, and am ordering more sets to give to friends at Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy O'Finner

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are difficult to put on bowls. However, once you get them on, they do the job! I find that using plastic wrap is just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Save on ceramic wraps!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cover fruit plates, juices, opened watermelons, leftovers ... and so many other things. It sure feels good to save on plastic wraps (save money and the environment!), and its seal is much better too. I’d recommend using glass containers with airtight lids for storing food in the fridge over night. But this cover is sufficient for a few hours. My only complaint is the set sticks to one another easily; I had to pull them apart every time.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I find these extremely hard to use. They are either too large or too small and I can't get them to stretch and hold. I don't recommend and have gone back to cling wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Flexible Babe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting something similar to the old ones we used that had an elastic band with thin plastic that went over the top. Boy was I surprised when these came. They are awesome. They stretched to cover pretty much bowls and glasses that we have. They are much stronger that the funky thin plastic crap and there is no elastic band to stretch out. I plan on ordering a bunch more of these to have on hand. I love them...
customer_reviews.author: Walter J. Zumbrennen

customer_reviews.title: Silicone Stretch Lids! The best!
customer_reviews.text: I really do like these silicone Lids! Stretch to fit lots of containers. And our sun tea glass jar had a metal lid that was starting to rust. Well, a silicone lid to the rescue. And it seals itself out in the sun, AND put the tea in the frig and just pull on one of the tabs and the flow of the tea will increase. Really like these lids. sending some to my daughters.
customer_reviews.author: Staanci

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I imagined, but feel that has ...
customer_reviews.text: Not exactly what I imagined, but feel that has more to do with having never used silicone covers before. I will say that before using these, I tested it with some colored water in a pyrex bowl and with this lid on it did not leak at all when turned completely upside down.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cook

customer_reviews.title: Handy and more efficient than plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.text: There are several sizes to fit most of my serving dishes. They do not seem to stretch as much as advertised, but that has not been a problem for me. It's a good value because they can be washed and reused, unlike plastic wrap. They are also fairly transparent so you can see what is in the container you covered, unlike foil.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile product!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this product. I have a water container that doesn’t have a lid, now I have one that works perfectly. I sometimes drink canned healthy soda however do not drink the entire can in one sitting. One of the lids fits perfectly to keep it fresh. I also often have left overs from my evening meal. I just use one of the lids to pull over the entire plate.
customer_reviews.author: sandra k fox

customer_reviews.title: Great with the right fit
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. We have lots of good containers with missing lids. The smaller sizes work great on those. The larger sizes are harder to use. The bowls we have are either too small or too big for a good fit. It is also challenging getting the silicone lids on the larger containers without spilling in the process, helpful to have someone hold the bowl while you stretch the silicone cover over the container. All in all pretty happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Mom

customer_reviews.title: I've cut down my plastic wrap use so much! Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! I tested it with a bowl of soup and shook it around, the silicone lid didn't budge one bit, no leaks. I tried using the small one on half an orange and it pulled too tight that juice leaked from the sides of the orange in my fridge. No biggie, I figured it was meant for dishes but was curious if it would on fruit. Might still work on something firmer, like a half an apple.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Yong Rhew

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to buy this product when I saw an ad for it. I wanted to get away from using plastic wrap. I was a little disappointed that the different sizes don't fit my containers. I thought they would be more stretchy and fit more sizes. Still use them on some things. I like that they are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on the first use.
customer_reviews.text: Ripped on the first use. The largest lid was way too big for the bowl and wouldn't seal, so I used the next size down. It was a struggle to get on and ripped. Update: I tried again, and used the largest size to cover a bowl of rising bread overnight. I even measured the bowl to assure it was the correct size for that particular lid! When I woke up in the morning, the lid had completely popped off. I had purchased these lids specifically for this purpose, so they're a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love using press and seal, but I wanted to get something that I can re-use to not be so wasteful. This is the perfect product. Highly recommend. It's simple, easy and quick to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: The only downfall I would give these things, are that they slide around too much and don't grab if there is too much moisture. But then again, it's silicone on glass. They're a little more fuss to put on than your typical plastic top, but I'm okay with that. They are great for opened cans and other odd ball containers!! I haven't had them long enough to really witness the true durability and lifetime of this item. I dd purchase 3 packs, so I hope to find plenty of use out of them. It's definitely worth paying for these vs the plastic tops that continue to crack. (Even being hand washed)
customer_reviews.author: JAMIE BEILER

customer_reviews.title: Useful instead of plastic wrap
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how useful these would be, but I started using them right away. They fit a variety of sized--not every size, but seem like they'd fit most things. The stretch is nice. I'm happy to be trying out something other than plastic wrap since there's so much plastic waste these days!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Seems very thin
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it 3 only because I bought a similar item before and can compare. This one is a lot thinner and has a strange marks which I feel it might break at... so far it didn’t though ... I like how it stretches over the bowls, it is great to have those to cover foid right in the serving dish.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These work well and fit on many different sizes and shapes. I can even use them on a rectangle container. They do not work as well after they have gotten wet (like in the fridge with condensation) but once you dry them they pop back on. Doesn't take much space and expands the dishes I can store food in. Also comes out great after putting in dishwasher. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Zcomstar

customer_reviews.title: Love These!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these but I wish they had a larger pack with more sizes. They are perfect for saving a soda in a can, left overs or covering up large glass containers if you've broken the glass tops. They don't have any odor whatsoever. I did notice that over a little time, you'll have to change them out say like on a sugar or flour container because they get a little less sticky but once you've washed it, it's good as new. I will definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, but not too easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, but not too easy to clean. overall decent purchase, i wouldnt pay more than $10 for the set though. I think I paid around $13.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Thought these would stretch more
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great and it works well for smaller bowls. The ad I saw on Facebook showed it being stretched over a watermelon half and the largest lid I received couldn't possibly stretch as large as that, in fact it really doesn't stretch out at all (again, this ad wasn't specifically for this vendor, I'm rather sure). I was hoping the largest one would fit the containers I use the most, but they don't, and they don't stretch like I thought they would. I'll still keep the product and use it on smaller bowls though.
customer_reviews.author: Helen C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace Tupperware covers that have broken, and man do these disappoint. They are hard to put on. When one side gets stretched over the container, the other side will likely pop off. The most annoying part of these is they slip off in the fridge. Any little bit of condensation that forms on the outside of the Tupperware renders these silicone covers useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kat H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on watermelon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to cover half a watermelon like in the picture. That's just not possible. It slips right off because it's neither plastic nor does it have a lip. Now i just cover cups and my KitchenAid bowl, which is fine but not what I bought this for.
customer_reviews.author: Eme

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Bought it for my wife and she said it was the best thing ever. Easy to cover things like watermelon, foods etc. no more clear plastic wrap that will not stick. No more covering up with plates. Theses are stretchable and will cover food and leftovers with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Eyekon1

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these lids! For years I've been putting into glass bowls or casserole dishes leftovers or salads or other concoctions that I've made. Then I covered them with aluminum foil. Nothing air tight. Foil would rip. Always a mess. These lids are fantastic. They stretch a lot to cover all sorts of size bowls. They are airtight and clean easily. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great for odd shaped containers.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used these extensively yet (just got them) but first tried them on an oval-shaped dish and it was perfect. these lids make any bowl or dish a storage container. I did not do a rigorous leak test just a quick test which went well, so I have no reason to believe they would not prove to be leak-proof with continued use. Very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: London Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Not for take off and put back on fridge dishes..
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact you could not put it back on, if the bowl/container was the least bit wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and works with so many of my containers
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous containers that either never had a cover or I've lost the cover so I went looking for a solution and found it with these covers. They have a good amount of stretch to them and can fit over a variety of shapes and sizes. So fa I haven't had one the hasn't fit. Does a great job of keeping things fresh and very easy to clean and reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Donna G

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money! These don't adhere to most bowls, or containers that are glass or plastic.
customer_reviews.text: These were a complete WASTE OF MONEY!. Don't fit most larger bowls even though ridges on plastic indicate that they should stretch to fit. I bought these specifically for largest lid to fit a vintage 10" pyrex bowl I use and it didn't fit nor stick to pyrex at all. Really, these are useless. I THREW THEM IN THE TRASH!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JoJo California

customer_reviews.title: Interesting
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a food keeper, however it is great for dog and cat food cans. I also believe you could probably cover camera and binocular lens. I wasn't able to check leak proof as I had nothing that was really leakable and I don't store animal food upside down. Thus far some sizes are not for me, but I knew that when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: weisster

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you $
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage ! I can not believe that there is people who think this product is great unless they get paid to write fake review. It just does not stay at all on the bowl and slipping away even if the size is right. Had to return it !
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Too small to fit over any of my dishes except a cereal bowl.
customer_reviews.text: Much too small to be useful for leftovers. They do not fit over a pasta bowl, dinner plate or other dishes. The smallest one just fits over half a lemon. They do not stretch to anywhere near the measurements given in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Lukens

customer_reviews.title: Reuse!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! Use one of them at least once a day. They work best over round/circular objects; square bowls can be a bit of a challenge. Also, they tend to spot after they are washed (hand/dishwasher). Still a lot better than cling/plastic wrap!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sati Afshari

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with instructions, didn't know if should boil before every use to make it simpler to apply. Takes a few tugs to get it on. Picture on site makes it look as if you just have to give a pull and voila, not the case. You have to be cautious when you have liquid in your container.
customer_reviews.author: medrkcm

customer_reviews.title: They come off from metal bowls.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a bit disappointed at these. They stretch and cover most of plates and bowls but they don’t stay on metal bowls. They slip off from those types. I use metal bowls a lot to cook and serve food. Otherwise I like the sizes of covers. They’re very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Mika M

customer_reviews.title: Junky. Doesn't stretch very much. I tried stretching ...
customer_reviews.text: Junky. Doesn't stretch very much. I tried stretching the large one over a pot of soup and it fell in the pot.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave it a three star cuz I found it difficult to use at first. Now I've had it for a while, I found myself liking it more and more after getting used to it. I think it's a good product to replace plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: ginboy

customer_reviews.title: They dont stay on
customer_reviews.text: Every morning I will open the fridge and find my food uncovered and the lid inside of the dish. I have tried using the lids on similar sized and similar shaped dishes and nothing makes a difference. Really wanted to love these. I wish I could return but I already used them. waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Happy I bought them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to reduce our use of ziplock bags and hopefully reduce our use of plastic in general. Also, we have an ongoing battle with Tupperware and their lids in our home. I ordered these lids and they worked great on a round bowl. We have rectangular glass bowls for storage too....so that was the real test. They worked great!!! I’m really happy with this choice!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Several sizes, and "sticky" too
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace covers for a bowl set, and I am very glad I selected these. They are sort of a sticky-stretch plastic which creates a good seal. When cleaning is needed, soap and hot water = good as new. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible thing
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worse thing I ever got from amazon. These things are not working at all. I tried different type of bowls, lids are not staying. I wish, I could return it, but probaly I just put it in garbage.
customer_reviews.author: atomic

customer_reviews.title: Helping the Environment
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful, one never has to use plastic wrap again, at least for round bowls.... Now they need to create them for rectangular and square shapes.... I even bought a package for my neighbor who is landfill conscious
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Storage
customer_reviews.text: I love this simple, effective product, especially good for saving half an apple or onion, fits tight and keeps fruit and vegetable fresh. Wish there were more small "lids" - I don't need the larger ones, I have lids for bowls that big.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Bandich

customer_reviews.title: Well made, just need to match them with the right size and must be round bowl.
customer_reviews.text: They’re pretty good. As long as what you’re covering is round, a bit larger than the stretch lid and doesn’t have a pouring spout at one end or something, they work ok. But don’t expect them to be an outright replacement for the original lid that apparently rolled off with one of your neighbors’ containers.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: 🌱No more single-use-plastic/products!!🌱
customer_reviews.text: I just got them and seem pretty nice! My goal is to reduce my single-use-plastic-products so I got this. Hopefully they are easy to clean and last long, I will post a actualization in a few weeks 👏😌 Also very cheap and versatile
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great re-usable substitute for plastic wrap!
customer_reviews.text: We've had these silicone lids for a few weeks now and continue to find containers to use with them. They fit my circular Pyrex bowls, Fiesta bowls, and the little one is great for putting on glasses/mugs. The little one even fits my wine decanter perfectly. I will probably buy another set, as they are always in use.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Slip off very easiliy
customer_reviews.text: Like the idea of them but in theory they don't work very well. If the container has any dampness to the bowl, it doesn't stay on unless you use a larger size and then it's not leak proof. Works best on glass containers than metal. Not expensive, so worth trying them out but wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: A Great Alternative to Plastic
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleasantly surprised at how useful and effective these covers are at preserving leftovers. I especially appreciate the long-term benefits of not having to use plastic film, and how relatively easy to clean and long-lived they are.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen item!
customer_reviews.text: These lids are freaking awesome! How I have lived without them for so long I have no idea. Now my tin foil and plastic wrap will be sitting in my drawer for who knows how long, considering I don’t have much use for them now. That’s a good thing!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Hall

customer_reviews.title: Correct size is so important.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I like these. Don’t know how water proof they are have not had a chance to use with liquid. I do have problems getting them on some containers, not as easy as I thought. If you can get the right size cover and bowl they are great. Still think I will get lots of use out them.
customer_reviews.author: Oceanside

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had a set like this that I bought at a home show years ago and it was good to see it was available now in Amazon. I bought it for my daughter and she loves it. Saves from using and throwing plastic wraps. Environmentally friendly and very useful for saving left over fruits or even food in a bowl that does not have a lid!
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: really versatile
customer_reviews.text: we are using these to cover everything, from half an onion, to open glass of coffee that my daughter wanted to refrigerate for iced coffee, to large pitchers. they are not hard to wash and so far seem durable.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food fresh longer
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these. I use them primarily for smaller items, like our cans of pumpkin (for the spoiled dog). We used to just cover the cans with aluminum, but these are so easy to use and keep food fresh for so much longer. I just throw them in the dishwasher when it’s time to clean them - so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hurchick

customer_reviews.title: Will work awesome if both lid and container are completely dry.
customer_reviews.text: I like that these fit all different shapes of containers. They work good, tight fit, and don't leak. The lid and container both need to be completely dry to use or they won't work. Also could be a little thicker material. I poked a hole in the small lid with my finger nail using to cover my cats food.
customer_reviews.author: ImTrouble

customer_reviews.title: Ditching the Saran Wrap
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a product that would allow us to cover items without using Saran wrap. These are great, but now I want some in bigger sizes to cover plates. I'll have to look and see if bigger sizes exist.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten Dart

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this product. It’s a waste of money. It doesn’t stay put it slides off any container. I bought this for my mom to make things easier but instead it does not work. It’s made out of the thinnest silicone material ever. Just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No where near expectations - extremely disappointed :(
customer_reviews.text: It's not as stretchable as it is advertised to be. It also doesn't grip the bowl or pot. Haven't tried the watermelon, but will let you know when I do. If I hadn't toss the wrappings and accidentally tore one, I would have love to return this for my money back or a better kind, it's quite useless to me. I was very excited to get it and then became totally disappointed. Gave it the extra cleaning star because I really only used one to have to clean it. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Vanmonirack Hour

customer_reviews.title: Love Them.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I have arthritic fingers so the ease of use is very important to me. They are very soft and easy to slip on and off dishes but I especially love them because they also fit perfect around watermelon halves and melons. Keeps everything fresh. They clean up in the dishwasher and I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to Plastic Wrap
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try something that was more environmentally friendly than plastic wrap and decided to give these a try. First off, I love the smiley face in the center of each stretch lid. It's a nice design touch. As for use, I've only used the smallest one to cover a can and a medium/small one on a glass bowl twice so far. All three times they have worked excellently. I'm very pleased so far with my purchase and will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay on.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. They just didn't stay on. I tried every size on every container and none of them stayed on. They flipped of either before I even got them in the fridge, or while they we in the refrigerator. Just not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Judybee

customer_reviews.title: sticky when hot
customer_reviews.text: The post office left the package in my mail box in the 100 degree heat. They tend to stick together when in extreme heat so don't try to heat something with the lid on. Great idea and I am looking forward to using them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Gibson, Ed.D.

customer_reviews.title: Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Glad I decided to try these. They arrived quickly. Applied one to a ceramic bowl the day they arrived. They went on easy and the fit was snug and secure. Did not check if it would leak. These will be a great addition to my kitchen. I might need a larger set.
customer_reviews.author: FreeReader

customer_reviews.title: They’re superb!
customer_reviews.text: We collect lots of leftovers in our family. My wife (not easily impressed with kitchen “gadgets”) absolutely loves them. They’re easy to use, easy to clean, and work great to seal a bowl for refrigerator storage.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

product_meta.title: Silicone Stretch Lids, 6-Pack Various Sizes Cover for Bowl
feature_bullets: IS THERE ANY LEFTOVER FOOD? Don’t throw it away! Simply cover it with these silicone lids and it will stay fresh until you get hungry again! The silicone food saver lids can be used to cover cooked food, fruit, salads, sauces, as well as drinks like coffee, tea, juice and more.

6 SILICONE LIDS IN VARIOUS SIZES: The i-Kawachi set includes 6 clear silicone covers in various sizes. Thanks to their stretchable material, the food lids will easily fit most bowls, pots, containers, mugs, cups, cans, jars, and you can even use them to cover your half-cut melon or watermelon.

ABSOLUTELY SAFE MATERIALS: Your safety is our top priority, for this reason we’ve made sure the silicone stretching lids are BPA-free, food grade and completely nontoxic. You can therefore use the stretch lids all the time without worrying about yours and your family’s health!

COLD AND HEAT RESISTANT: Feel free to put the stretchable food lid in the freezer or even in the microwave and dishwasher. Since the silicone material is resistant to low and high temperatures (up to 450F), the bowl stretch lid will remain intact and as good as new for a very long time.

ECO-FRIENDLY AND ECONOMICAL: The silicone stretch cover lids will reduce your plastic waste and help you save money, since you will no longer need to buy cellophane to cover your leftover food fresh. Plus, the bowl lid does a much better job at keeping your food fresh!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars3,370 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
